repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This automatically downloads and uses the correct luals binary for the
currently used system. `make luals` will run luals on all lua files in
`runtime`.

We download lua-language-server manually instead of relying on
contributors downloading it on their own (like with stylua) as
lua-language-server is updated frequently which may cause unnecessary
friction. Therefore, we download a pinned version of luals which we then
can manually bump when needed. This can be re-evaluated if luals becomes
more stable in the future.

Currently this is not run when using `make lint` since cmake style "file
caching" doesn't seem possible at the moment. This is because checking a
single file doesn't seem to work.

Work on https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24563.

comment_data.body: Maybe move that up before luacheck, to keep the checks organized by language?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -77,6 +77,10 @@ jobs:
         name: uncrustify
         run: cmake --build build --target lintc-uncrustify
 
+      - if: success() || failure() && steps.abort_job.outputs.status == 'success'

@@ -26,7 +27,7 @@ local SearchMembers = nil
 -- # Vim completion script
 -- # Language:	C
 -- # Maintainer:	The Vim Project <https://github.com/vim/vim>
--- # Last Change:	2023 Aug 10
+-- # Last Change:	2024 Jun 06

@@ -90,7 +91,7 @@ Qf_filter = function(qf, searchpat, bang)
   end
 
   items = vim9.fn_mut('filter', { Xgetlist(), Cond }, { replace = 0 })
-  title = cmd .. ' /' .. pat .. '/'
+  title = string.format([=[{cmd} /{pat}/]=])

comment_data.body:
Since these files are generated, I'd prefer not to make any code changes here. 

Simply ignore the whole file (as you are doing).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,7 +49,7 @@ Qf_filter = function(qf, searchpat, bang)
     Xsetlist = function(...)
       return vim.fn['setqflist'](...)
     end
-    cmd = ':Cfilter' .. bang
+    cmd = string.format([=[:Cfilter{bang}]=])

comment_data.body:
This is what vim9jit generated.

Edit: I see now what you mean, vim9jit doesn't generate the code correctly.

   end
 
   items = vim9.fn_mut('filter', { Xgetlist(), Cond }, { replace = 0 })
-  title = cmd .. ' /' .. pat .. '/'
+  title = string.format([=[{cmd} /{pat}/]=])

> Did you regenerate the files in this PR, or why was this changed?

I did at first, but I reverted it (except I kept the lines that disabled lints)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -90,7 +91,7 @@ Qf_filter = function(qf, searchpat, bang)
   end

comment_regular_data.body:
Problems:
- Me and clason get completely different number of errors when we run `make luals`, he gets around 550 and I get around 450.
- Clason gets warnings from runtime/lua/vim/shared.lua but I don't.
- The number of errors is not deterministic. It gives out different number of problems for the same command. Both clason and I can recreate this problem.

Conclusion: we're dealing with a S-rank special grade cursed tool.

Difference is from a flaky false positive on `lua/vim/shared.lua`, which seems to be a race condition in inference. "Fixed" by forcing the type via annotation.

Similar issue in `lua/coxpcall.lua`; here an annotation didn't help and I just disabled diagnostics on the affected line. (It's not our code anyway.)
I would not spend time fixing up the generator scripts in this PR; that's way too much work. Better to restrict the lint step to `runtime/lua` for now.
Let's go with all lua files in `runtime` at least since all lua files there pass the check now after vim9jit updates.

title: build: add luals check
